text: we currently make the flu vaccine in
chicken eggs this is actually a
technology that was developed in the mid
1900s it works pretty well so vaccine
makers just have kept using it in order
to make one vaccine it takes
approximately one egg so at this site
there is almost 1 million eggs per day
that are delivered on average it would
take about six months for that egg that
comes into the door to a final dose
vaccine that goes to one of our
customers along the way that vaccine
spends about 70 percent of its time in
quality control testing this lag between
choosing what we need to put in this
vaccine and producing the vaccine gives
the virus a lot of time to to outrun us
flu vaccine starts with inoculating eggs
with one of the four strains that are
selected by the w-h-o the viruses treat
the chicken egg like one giant cell and
they just use the egg to make lots and
lots of copies of themselves and then
the vaccine producers will take out the
viruses they will purify them they will
test them it's a very long process
